headline.main: An Unintentional Gift of Information to Berlin

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 23 -- If members of Congress had not been bombarding the Maritime Commission with demands for greater use of port facilities south and north of New York City and San Francisco, and if the commission's publicity department had been careful in phrasing a statement issued yesterday, the German Navy would not today have the useful information that war materiel for Russia is soon to be shipped from Boston to Archangel.
